contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Kamikoshiki'''|上甑村|Kamikoshiki-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Satsuma District, Kagoshima|Satsuma District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On October 12, 2004 Kamikoshiki was merged with the towns of [[Hiwaki, Kagoshima|Hiwaki]], [[Iriki, Kagoshima|Iriki]], [[Kedōin, Kagoshima|Kedōin]] and [[Tōgō, Kagoshima|Tōgō]], and the villages of [[Kashima, Kagoshima|Kashima]], [[Sato, Kagoshima|Sato]] and [[Shimokoshiki, Kagoshima|Shimokoshiki]], all from [[Satsuma District, Kagoshima|Satsuma District]], and the old city of [[Sendai, Kagoshima|Sendai]], to form the new city of [[Satsumasendai, Kagoshima|Satsumasendai]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 1,900 and the [[population density|density]] of 54.10 persons per km². The total area was 35.12 km². [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
